node.title: Country which gave up COVID restrictions in September prepares to bring them back
node.description: Denmark's government on Monday proposed reinstating the use of a digital "corona pass".
node.content: ["Denmark's government on Monday proposed reinstating the use of a digital \"corona pass\" to be presented when Danes visit indoor bars and restaurants, as the country is entering a third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.", "Denmark was one of few countries to lift almost all remaining restrictions in September after having avoided a third wave of infections over spring and summer due to broad lockdown measures imposed since Christmas.", "But the number of daily infections has risen steadily to around 2300 in recent days from a low of just over 200 in mid-September.", "The positivity rate, the share of total tests made that were positive, has also risen steadily in the past weeks from 1.2 percent in mid-September to 2.3 percent by the end of October.", "Scientists say the positivity rate can be a better indicator of a virus' spread than the raw number of daily cases, as studies have shown it correlates better with mortality. A high positivity rate suggests a higher number of infections that aren't being detected.\u00a0", "\"Several European countries are now in the middle of their fourth wave of corona. In Denmark we are heading into our third corona wave,\" Health Minister Magnus Heunicke said during a televised briefing on Monday.", "The corona pass, which is usually presented via an app on Danes' phones, is used to verify that the holder is vaccinated or has tested negative for the coronavirus.", "The measure presented by the Government, which is subject to Parliamentary approval, will also require the pass to be presented for indoor gatherings over 200, such as in cinemas and museums.", "\"It can't be said clearly enough: those of you who have not been vaccinated, do so,\" said Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen.\u00a0", "\"The government stands on the side of the 90 percent or so that does what one should do. The others should not destroy it for the rest.\"\u00a0", "If the Danish government decides to declare COVID-19\u00a0 'critical threat to society' again would unlock the ability to close schools and order masks mandates, the Financial Times reported.", "\"The move to declassify COVID-19 was never communicated as an irreversible thing,\" Soren Riis Paludan, professor of biomedicine at Aarhus University told the paper.", "\"The fact that cases are going up is seen by many as evidence for the argument that unvaccinated people have extra responsibility for keeping COVID-19 circulating. Therefore, reintroducing the COVID pass can also serve the purpose to force more people to get vaccinated.\"", "New Zealand's target for lifting most restrictions on movement is 90 percent of those eligible - Denmark is already at over 88 percent. The difference is we won't have our equivalent of the 'corona pass' in place until regions hit 90 percent.\u00a0", "Denmark has 76 percent total coverage, compared to our 65 percent, according to Our World in Data.\u00a0", "Reuters / Newshub.", "\u00a0"]
